page.title: 11FARMING IV
page.content: { {Employment-}Fewer men are now employed on the land- 24 including farmers themselves. Greater skills are now required for the more complex machinery in use. Most farmers use outside contractors in varying degrees They are used for operations such as hedge-cutting, ditching, repairing fences and dykes, and less frequently for silaging and combine harvesting. Two foresters are employed on Cowhill Estate. {Weather problems-}1984 was disastrous- ly dry for the lighter land and in complete contrast 1985 was disastrous- ly wet for all land with persistent rain and wind. This year many stackyards are littered with black polythene bags of silage as farmers tried to salvage hay and barley crops.
